verses.verse: In that day<WH3117> Jehovah<WH3068> with his hard<WH7186> and great<WH1419> and strong<WH2389> sword<WH2719> will punish<WH6485> leviathan<WH3882> the swift<WH1281> serpent<WH5175>, and leviathan<WH3882> the crooked<WH6129> serpent<WH5175>; and he will slay<WH2026> the monster<WH8577> that is in the sea<WH3220>.
In that day<WH3117>: A vineyard<WH3754> of wine<WH2561>, sing ye unto it<WH6031>.
I Jehovah<WH3068> am its keeper<WH5341>; I will water<WH8248> it every moment<WH7281>: lest any hurt<WH6485> it<WH5341>, I will keep it night<WH3915> and day<WH3117>.
Wrath <WH2534> is not in me<WH5414>: would that the briers<WH8068> and thorns<WH7898> were against me in battle<WH4421>! I would march<WH6585> upon them<WH6702>, I would burn them together<WH3162>.
Or else let him take hold<WH2388> of my strength<WH4581>, that he may make<WH6213> peace<WH7965> with me<WH6213>; yea, let him make peace with me<WH7965>.

In days to come<WH935> shall Jacob<WH3290> take root<WH8327>; Israel<WH3478> shall blossom<WH6692> and bud<WH6524>; and they shall fill<WH4390> the face<WH6440> of the world<WH8398> with fruit<WH8570>.
Hath he smitten<WH5221> them as he smote<WH4347> those that smote<WH5221> them<WH2026>? or are they slain according to the slaughter<WH2027> of them that were slain by them<WH2026>?

In measure<WH5432>, when thou sendest<WH7971> them away<WH7378>, thou dost contend with them<WH1898>; he hath removed them with his rough<WH7186> blast<WH7307> in the day<WH3117> of the east wind<WH6921>.

Therefore by this<WH2063> shall the iniquity<WH5771> of Jacob<WH3290> be forgiven<WH3722>, and this is all the fruit<WH6529> of taking away<WH5493> his sin<WH2403>: that he maketh<WH7760> all the stones<WH68> of the altar<WH4196> as chalkstones<WH1615> that are beaten in sunder<WH5310>, so that the Asherim<WH842> and the sun-images<WH2553> shall rise no more<WH6965>.

For the fortified<WH1219> city<WH5892> is solitary<WH910>, a habitation<WH5116> deserted<WH5800> and forsaken<WH7971>, like the wilderness<WH4057>: there shall the calf<WH5695> feed<WH7462>, and there shall he lie down<WH7257>, and consume<WH3615> the branches thereof<WH5585>.

When the boughs<WH7105> thereof are withered<WH3001>, they shall be broken off<WH7665>; the women<WH802> shall come<WH935>, and set them on fire<WH215>; for it is a people<WH5971> of no understanding<WH998>: therefore he that made<WH6213> them will not have compassion<WH7355> upon them<WH3335>, and he that formed them will show them no favor<WH2603>.

And it shall come to pass in that day<WH3117>, that Jehovah<WH3068> will beat off<WH2251> his fruit from the flood<WH7641> of the River<WH5104> unto the brook<WH5158> of Egypt<WH4714>; and ye shall be gathered<WH3950> one<WH259> by one<WH259>, O ye children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

And it shall come to pass in that day<WH3117>, that a great<WH1419> trumpet<WH7782> shall be blown<WH8628>; and they shall come<WH935> that were ready to perish<WH6> in the land<WH776> of Assyria<WH804>, and they that were outcasts<WH5080> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>; and they shall worship<WH7812> Jehovah<WH3068> in the holy<WH6944> mountain<WH2022> at Jerusalem<WH3389>.
